website_summaries.verdict: This cooktop gives you more control than other brands, with only 10 degrees in between temperature settings.
pros: Cooks at 52 temperatures between 100 and 575 degrees
Auto shutoff when  pan is removed
cons: Difficulty heating large quantities of water or oil to useable temperature in a reasonable time

customer_reviews.title: Prime Deals Group is not an authorized dealer so any warranty was no good
customer_reviews.text: The (30151) NuWaveTM PIC2 I purchased new from: “Prime Deals Group” was defective. It took over 30 minutes to boil 8 quarts of water. I contacted: Prime Deals Group and they said I needed to contact the manufacturer so I called the number they gave me and NuWave Corporate Office told me: Prime Deals Group was not an authorized dealer so the warranty was no good. So I contacted Amazon and they refunded me my money.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very hit or miss.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat more expensive, and once in a while less reliable than other similar products, but very good temperature control. I am a pretty good judge of this induction hotplate, as I've been through five of them. I'll say this, the built in thermometer is accurate, and this hotplate is my go-to for sous vide eggs. Out of five, two had the fan die, one had the glass crack and eventually break, and two are still working. I'll say all of this is only after heavy use, but the two still in service were bought earlier than the ones that broke. Take it for what it's worth, I still prefer nuwave over other induction hot plates.
customer_reviews.author: Snaccs

customer_reviews.title: Solar Panels power my NuWave cooktop !
customer_reviews.text: I have one in my Tiny House. Runs off my 3000 / 6000 Watt Inverter which is attached to 465 Amp Hours of Deep cycle Solar Batteries which are connected to 500watts of DC Solar panels. It is best to operate this cooktop during the afternoon on a sunny day because it sucks a LOT of wattage and amperage and can easily drain my solar batteries if I were to operate it in the evening or at night. I keep this cooktop as a back up for when I run out of canned butane that fuels my camping stove (single gas burner). The NuWave allows me to go completely off grid, operating off solar powered electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Jay from Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY ON THIS TRASH !!
customer_reviews.text: SORRY PIECE OF JUNK. I HAD THE NEXT 1 UP [1800WATT 5 DEGREE TEMP ] IT BROKE, BUT I HAD TO REPLACE IT W/ THIS 1 CAUSE THE COMPANY WOULDNT HONOR THE GARENTEE & THE PRICE MORE THAN DOUBLED [TO 140$] THIS ONE SHOWED UP BROKE VERY SLOW TO HEAT EVEN ON HIGHEST TEMP-- SMELLS LIKE BURNING INSULATION ALL THE TIME !!! SORRY I BOUGHT IT----I'M CHANGING BRANDS--U SHOULD TOO!
customer_reviews.author: dr arnett

customer_reviews.title: Cooking with gas
customer_reviews.text: I think the term "cooking with gas" just got obsolete. I have more control over my cook top cooking that I have ever had in my life. I would have gotten a range that works on this principal if I had known what I know now. It will trip a breaker if you have anything else on the same circuit...
customer_reviews.author: S. Aiken

customer_reviews.title: GET ONE !
customer_reviews.text: I want to say OMG. Their great, cause they are. Easy to use . Make sure you dont have copper or aluminium pans . Ya need steel or Iron . We bought two because you usually need to have two burners when making a meal. We love them . They would make a great gift Students.or old people . Great for small areas. Easy to keep in a drawer or box when not needed freeing up space. GET ONE !
customer_reviews.author: Bruce w. Salyers

customer_reviews.title: I'll never be without this
customer_reviews.text: Oh, do I ever love this cooktop.....so much that I ordered another just in case this one ever gives out. My electric bill has gone down and truthfully, I never use my stove anymore. Between this, my micro and my air fryer and convection oven, I've got it made. I did have to buy some pots out of steel but that was a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Selective

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived. Power cord defective. Second one arrived. Worked for 1 min and then shorted out. Finally third on shows up and finally works. If you have time to wait on company to keep sending you out new units then a great buy for you. If it wasn’t a Christmas gift for someone I would have just gotten our money back.
customer_reviews.author: stephen valard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you are remodeling
customer_reviews.text: We remodeled the kitchen and lived downstairs. This is what I used to cook on for the month that we didn't have a stove. I bought pans separately but I guess it was a better deal if you look for this cooktop and pans as a combo. Now that I have my new kitchen, I haven't used it much but so happy that I had it and didn't have to go out for meals for a whole month, saved lots of money.
customer_reviews.author: Glamor girl

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: glad i added one of these to my kitchen, works great. the only issue i had was the first unit would constantly error out and not detect my cookware, so returned it and got another one and it has worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Minerva Moon

customer_reviews.title: Versitile and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This has changed my life. I have a small gas stove which only has a medium and high setting, and this has let me cook things like rice and chili again! I have recently switched to using all cast iron cookware, which works wonderfully with induction cooking. With a few small changes (non of my old aluminum pots will work), it does make stovetop cooking much more versatile. Paired with a small cast iron grill plate, large skillet, large pot, and small dutch oven, you can pretty much cook anything you would normally make on a stove or grill, or in a rice cooker or slow cooker.
customer_reviews.author: CembalistaTop Contributor: Pianos

customer_reviews.title: I suggest taking notes to determine the best settings for each thing you like to cook as ...
customer_reviews.text: I am still discovering new things about how to cook with this device. It is far more practical than the stove burners: more efficient, cleaner, faster, more precise and controlled. I suggest taking notes to determine the best settings for each thing you like to cook as it takes a little experimentation, but your first try will be more controlled than any stove top burner..
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Vincelette Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This cooktop has been a life saver. Our kitchen ...
customer_reviews.text: This cooktop has been a life saver. Our kitchen is undergoing a complete renovation, and the cooktop is serving as our stovetop. We are doing well with it along with a Breville toaster oven, microwave, and grill. My only reservation is that the temperature shown on the display panel is not quite accurate, but I've learned to adjust. A simmer is actually 240F rather that the 220F I expected. Most of my cookware won't work, but I have enough cast iron and sheet steel pans to do the job. When the kitchen renovation is finished, I still plan to use the induction cooktop, especially in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: RuthB

customer_reviews.title: A Great Portable Induction Burner
customer_reviews.text: An absolute lifesaver. I'm using this constantly in our camping trailer. Heats water instantly and is never hot to the touch. Pretty compact unit. It's got 3 feet on the bottom that keep it from sliding around. The cooktop has no ridges, so you can place any size pan on it without having to worry about it touching the controls. I'm so glad I go this model, as it's exactly what I needed! I would not hesistate to recommend this to anyone who wants a portable induction burner.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Temperature Adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this induction cooktop after I moved to a rental with an electric stove. It works great and I love using it, especially with my stovetop pressure cooker. This induction cooktop allows temperature adjustment in 5 degree increments. That's really important. The first induction cooktop (recommended by Wirecutter) did not allow me to make small temperature adjustments. It is now in the Goodwill donation pile.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy O

customer_reviews.title: Marriage saver!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves to deep fry. I am disgusting by deep frying and deep fried things. When he'd deep fry before it was a war zone: oil bubbling over, oil burning and stinking up the house, and the disgusting smell clinging for days afterward. Now we're both happy. He gets this beautiful marriage-saving machine. The perfect temp settings make sure nothing burns or boils over and if he's cooking something extra disgusting like deep fried butter balls or fish he can take it out into the garage!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Mills

customer_reviews.title: High Tech Cooktop
customer_reviews.text: A good cooktop if used with the correct cookware. Inductive cookware contains ferrous or iron containing metal that will heat up with the magnetic friction that the cooktop generates. I tested the cooktop by heating 250 ml of 75°F water to boiling using the cooktop on SEAR and my electric stove on high. The cooktop boiled the water in 2 minutes and 30 seconds. The stove boiled the water in 3 minutes and 50 seconds.I don't know what the power consumption was but it seemed that the cooktop was faster and made less waste heat.
customer_reviews.author: B. Radley

customer_reviews.title: Defective and Used
customer_reviews.text: This is the second NuWave ordered in the past month. BOTH did not work. It's bothersome because I used my very first NuWave PIC for over 5 years before it wore out. I would not recommend using this distributer. There is an E7 error. My guess is I received one that was previously returned by another customer. Crummy!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: As you can see in the photo, the digital ...
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the photo, the digital numbers do not all light up. I did not use this item after I had thrown the box away. I had a dinner party yesterday and that is when I saw there was a problem with the digital numbers . They do not all light up correctly and I have to guess on what the temp is and also when using the time function. I had to use the unit because of what I was cooking for my party. I don't want to go thru the process/hassle of sending it back but NuWave needs to know about this. I think they should send me a knee one. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Leavitt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cooktop but only for indcution capable cookware
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cooktop. Excellent quality. Be sure that you understand it uses "Induction" heating, meaning you must have induction capable cookware. This will not heat aluminum, copper etc. The cookware must be steel based that a magnet will stick to or is made as induction capable.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Best induction cooker!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second induction cooker we have purchased from this great dealer. Having this induction cooker means no more constant tending to delicate sauces and no more baby sitting a hot pan. The temperature control is just amazing and brings liquids to a boil much faster than a gas stove. We refused to buy from the tv ad but this is a great deal from this seller. The auto shut off makes it a good choice for those who have trouble remembering they put something on to cook. We plan on getting another for an elderly relative.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for small kitchens
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how much I would like this at first, but I've come to love how quickly it cooks food and does what it says it will do. It cooks more evenly than my stove top and takes less time. It's also safer, in that there are no hot burners to scald little fingers or catch loose clothing on fire. I also like being able to adjust the cooking temperature more precisely even as something is cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Finger

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had switched to induction cooking earlier, the hardest part was getting a good pan that I liked that was also compatible. If a magnet doesn't stick to your pan it will not work on this. So when you go buying things to use on this bring a magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Pla77

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to the range
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these counter top cookers for many years. The edge around the pan does not get hot. The energy use is much less than a range. I do not burn things any more. Meals are ready much faster. It fails after 5 or 6 years, but it is cheap to replace. We use it a lot for all kinds of cooking.
customer_reviews.author: bobo  garner

customer_reviews.title: Like all inductions the complaints are in the pans not ...
customer_reviews.text: If you use the right pans it works well. Like all inductions the complaints are in the pans not the stove. It is simple and my 87 year old mother uses it exclusively now. It can not be left on too long. it will not set fire to plastic on the burner and it turns its self off if the pan is removed. That is not to say it will do it without complaining, sending an annoying beep, but that OK.
customer_reviews.author: Horus R. IceRaven

customer_reviews.title: Fine product
customer_reviews.text: Top gets really hot after using it. Be careful not to touch the surface. It boils water so quick. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: srvrich

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have now used it about 6 times. I have made a pot of chili, and a pot of soup on it. Works very well! I love the heat control! I could bring my chili right to a simmer and hold it dead on. I use this in my RV, saves on using the propane, and doesn't cause a lot of extra heat inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Catering Gig
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a few catering jobs that had remote kitchens set up away from the guest. Great for getting pans Hot in a short time. Remember to use a flat bottom pan only. Light weight and a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great great great
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an induction stove top but wanted to try it out before I took the plunge. I will now be purchasing the stove top because this is so great, it warms evenly and cooks like gas, when you turn it down the heat actually goes down you can program it to keep things warm, its amazing. Best thing is that I can use electricity therefore use solar and still have the control and ease of gas.
customer_reviews.author: julie wood

customer_reviews.title: Induction Base Cooks Very Well
customer_reviews.text: When we bought this little induction cook-top, we were suspicious of it as an As Seen on TV product. Cooks very quickly. The only downside is that the pots for using it must have iron bottoms, making them a little more expensive than others. The cook kit we bought for camping works on it very well. The heater top is highly adjustable, making it just right for a number of varied cooking tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Ted LehmannTop Contributor: Country Music

customer_reviews.title: Great for Easily Distracted Cooks!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I am easily distracted and have been known to let pots boil dry- once popping boiled eggs all over the ceiling! This is a great product as you can set it and walk away. Nothing has burned in the weeks that I have used it on a daily basis. EZ clean up and I let it sit on my stovetop since I use it all the time instead of the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use in our RV instead of using the stove top. It also means I can take it outside to cook and keep the heat out there. It works great. Pans heat up in seconds and I can clean it and put it away just minutes after using it. I love how you can adjust the temperature but 5 degrees at a time. It heats evenly and cooks nicely. I mostly use my cast iron pans on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: Stop With The Zip Ties!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure this is a new product, as it didn’t come in original packaging. Seems fine enough. Unfortunately whoever packaged this zip tied the electrical cord so tightly that it damaged the cord. Still seems to work okay.
customer_reviews.author: juggalettekt

customer_reviews.title: Great for sitting and cooking
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of back pain when standing and I like being able to sit and cook something at the table that is going to take a long time.
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: ... living in an assisted living apartment and it works perfect for what she needs
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my mom and she absolutely loves it she is living in an assisted living apartment and it works perfect for what she needs. We have one on our houseboat and use it constantly and just knew it would be great for her needs and it is!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Young

customer_reviews.title: Fine But Somewhat Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The product works as advertised but my wife and I are disappointed that you really need to buy the pots and pans that are compatible. When seeking to use some of our pans (which are similar to the ones advertised by Nuwave, we found that only one worked so it created a somewhat bummed out experience. In purchasing this product take advantage of the different appliances they also offer.
customer_reviews.author: Charles ho56jhijn08iuuijbk8iikjk6i6out 89ih j 9i outgunnygm 7kojmiiiii77ui87uoojiiiioiiojyik9iPowell

customer_reviews.title: Be Carefull What You Buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nuwave Precision Induction cooktop in March 2017. It stopped working after only using it a few times. Says in the description has a one year warranty. I contacted the manufacturer and was told that Amazon isn't an authorized dealer and they will not exchange it. I will not be buying anything else from NuWave and it will also limit the stuff I buy from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Ten degree fine tune. Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for PIC2. This is the third induction cooktops I purchased and the one I used most often.I've found It far more convenient to set temperature in this one than my other two. It is capable of 10 degree fine tune, way better than any I've read about.
customer_reviews.author: Morning star

customer_reviews.title: It's fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this product. It makes meals so much faster than my regretted smooth top electric stove. This turned out to be well used this summer with all the terrible fires nearby that caused us to seal up and keep smoke out. Using this allowed us to avoid adding more heat to the house. So glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Crissy C

customer_reviews.title: love it. have not used the stove since we ...
customer_reviews.text: love it . have not used the stove since we started using induction. Would be nice if it had a power switch for it arks power every time we plug it in. Have been using a power strip because over time it would cook our outlet
customer_reviews.author: walt

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing cooktop! I bought it while I was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing cooktop ! I bought it while I was looking for a new range and it saved me a lot of money on eating out . Make sure you use cast iron , stainless steel , or ceramic cookware . I had to dig out my grandmother's cast iron skillet and dutch oven because it is an induction cooktop. Great also for an extra burner . I would buy again .
customer_reviews.author: txreadingnook

customer_reviews.title: Loved to use it while it last
customer_reviews.text: Everything was going perfect! I have wanted one of these for a while until my son turn on the stove instead of the nuwave while this was on top of it!!! Yeah he did that!!! He’s a teen but it never occurred him to even ask how to use it. So now i have to wait until is available again to buy it
customer_reviews.author: Veronica V

customer_reviews.title: My go to appliance
customer_reviews.text: It did take me a week or so to really get this baby cooking. I'll bet if I had read the instructions, a booklet and then some I might have mastered it faster. The teapot whistles quickly. Even better set it to sear with a nice big skillet and I've made some of the best steaks I've ever eaten.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: would be nice to know temps to use
customer_reviews.text: The cook top stays hot long after the pan is removed. The instructions say you can not place on a stove, so I have no exhaust fan while cooking. It is hard to find pots and pans to work with cook top unless cast iron. The temperature control takes a bit to get used to, would be nice to know temps to use. As I'm not the best cook it took me a while to find the right temp to fry eggs.
customer_reviews.author: James R

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: This is refreshingly simple and works as advertised. I was excited to be able to sear with my lodge cookware, which doesn't get hot enough on my ceramic stove. I look forward to using it more!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L. Bruha

customer_reviews.title: cooks best friend
customer_reviews.text: I have had my eye on this cook top for about a year( I just couldn't justify the high price the manufacture wanted) so when I came a crossed it on Amozon I had to have it. I am not a very experienced cook but let me tell you, I can now fry chicken to perfection!!!! And the price was a steal. If you don't have a cast iron skillet I recommend that you get one( it will become your best friend in the kitchen)
customer_reviews.author: seet pea cali

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooktop.
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of these to use for a student Seed to Table program and I love that they are safe and easy to use. Heat up quickly and evenly. Bought for my son to use in his tiny basement "apartment" in Brooklyn! He loves it. Be sure to have the proper cookware on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great for camper
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our RV...love it!! It is nice not to have to start up the propane stove and it cooks very even.
customer_reviews.author: REB0556

customer_reviews.title: Cooktop on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy cooking on my NuWave cooktop. I purchased it to use in our RV but have been trying it out in the house for 3 weeks. Being able to cook at a controlled temperature is a plus. Much more versital than using an electric skillet. I especially like that the unit outside the cook area does not get hot and it cools down quickly once the pan is removed. Very safe. Easy to transport and easy to store when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Was my first induction unit. Still performs well within its limitations. Not a subtle slam. It's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Cook Top Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Nuwave Precision Cook top! This little stove top works better than the traditional stove top! It cooks everything to perfection! I can control the temp so much better and so precise with this unlike the traditional stove top burner. I highly recommend this product to anyone that wants their food to taste as it should!
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It is amazing how quickly it comes up to heat. Surprisingly light weight. Cleans up easy and pretty compact. Holds a 8 qt. Dutch oven full of chili.
customer_reviews.author: David A

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Motorhome
customer_reviews.text: I now have 4 of these, 1 for my Diesel Semi, 1 for my Motorhome and 2 for my home. They cook fast and efficient just as advertised. They only heat the pot not the whole kitchen. Great for the Motorhome, and Big Truck. Love em.
customer_reviews.author: Donald C Powers

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: This ad for this product misrepresent what you are looking for or at.I ordered the product because the descriptions for this item are random at best so I looked at the pictures provided of the product to confirm the product I ordered which is a Newave2 . Also the pan that comes with the Newave2 is pictured in the advertisement also . What I received was a Newave, not Newave 2 and pan . Which would be more price appropriate
customer_reviews.author: Sondra Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Heart of an on Induction Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I really love this unit. Need to get acquainted better with cooking temps and stainless steel adapter for non-inductive cookware(most of mine)..Only complaint is the fan is kinda loud! Nice size and seems very well built! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: L. Bourassa

customer_reviews.title: No home, or trucker should be with out one of these babies
customer_reviews.text: This item was strongly recommended to me by a fellow trucker, and her due did steer me right on this! Great item, think I'll get another one for my home.
customer_reviews.author: A. Scataglia

customer_reviews.title: I loved it when I got it
customer_reviews.text: I loved it when I got it. The fan was a bit louder than I expected but not horrible. The only problem was that it quit working at the end of the 1st week! Returned it for a refund and bought one from another company...Simply Ming. It is quieter and no issues...yet.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rabenberg

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE ON LIKE-NEW 'NuWave 2' INDUCTION COOKTOP
customer_reviews.text: This was a USED 'NuWave 2' 1300-Watt Precision Induction Cooktop but it came in perfect working condition with no noticeable wear & had all of its Manuals & printed info. Worked great when tested with pans equipped with an Induction Plate. Very happy with it, good price!
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. I must say I love it and it heats up water in less than a min to boil rice or noddles. I can also melt chocolate without burning it.
customer_reviews.author: James Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but...
customer_reviews.text: Works great but beware, it says you can use pots and pans that are magnetic, but I noticed if you don't use "induction ready" branded cookware, it's takes wayyy you longer... buy this, but also buy the cookware set.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Katz

customer_reviews.title: happy with this
customer_reviews.text: great product , I ordered another one, when you finish cooking with this you don't have a big cleaning job waiting. in fact you just wipe it off and your done.
customer_reviews.author: Diana C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cook top. You can cook anything on this. The pan heats rapidly, yet the cook top stays cool. We use this in one of our work site trailers, our guys cook their breakfast sandwiches on it every morning. So convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Webster

customer_reviews.title: It worked beautifully for about two days
customer_reviews.text: It worked beautifully for about two days. It stopped working in the middle of cooking and could no longer be turned back on. Too bad, because I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: ycypai

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work as well as older models but works ok
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work as well as older models but works ok
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: A best buy
customer_reviews.text: Other than having to buy a few new pans and a skillet, this is wonderful! Comes up to heat much quicker than the old style and maintains temperatures perfectly. My wife is really pleased with this cooktop and she's ultra picky about items she uses in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: I love the induction cooktop
customer_reviews.text: I love the induction cooktop,but, be aware that you really need to check your existing cookware with the magnet test. None of my cookware was compatible with this cooktop. I had to buy extra cookware. I keep a magnet in my purse for future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn beanblossom

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Faster and much more efficient than our old 220 volt commercial countertop burner and less than half the price. I've used countertop burners in my restaurant for thirteen years and this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: leecrowell

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our electric circuit always cut short when we use an appliance that consumes too much wattage. Fortunately, with this cooktop, that has still never happened. I've been using this for more than a month now and I love it! I recommend this for people who live in a studio or apartment that always has short circuits and want to save time when cooking. It cooks fast! It really does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A nice product
customer_reviews.text: It looked really nice but you need special pots and pans to use it. I returned because I did not want to purchase more pots and pans. I must say that the seller was extremely nice about returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: I use this product allllll the time and love it. I ordered a new one
customer_reviews.text: I have used mine for over 3 years, and (after transporting it to another place and back), it decided to not recognize any of my induction cookware. I tried several of them and got the E1 error on all. I use this product allllll the time and love it. I ordered a new one. I wish I had two. Maybe mine will magically start working again; then I will have two.
customer_reviews.author: SFG

customer_reviews.title: Great for the most part
customer_reviews.text: Loved it except the buttons are breaking and it’s only 7 months old
customer_reviews.author: Kim Clark

customer_reviews.title: love this nice to have an extra burner...
customer_reviews.text: Set it and for get it ... I have to cook chinese herbs and it would make a mess on my stove . This cuts time is more consistent and clean up is breeze.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia ewing

customer_reviews.title: Great control of temperature
customer_reviews.text: I keeps the same temperature for up to 99.99 hours. AMAZING. I haven't seen anything like that after researching online for more than 3 days. I am glad I chose this one. It meets all my needs. Precise control of temperature for VERY LONG time. Programmable in four stages. I can even heat my ferromagnetic knifes or empty pans on top of it. I does not overheat like some other induction stove I chose that was making my empty pots and tools red hot even when the stove was in low setting. It is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: love it I know the tem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to deep fry food. love it I know the tem,without guessing.NO MESS TO CLEAN UP ON THE COOK STOVE! I just put wax paper on the counter around the Nuwave, and away we go.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: This makes so much noise I can't even carry on a conversation in the same room. Then I found it had been sent to someone else before and must have been returned. Poor quality craftsmanship . It does heat if you can stand the noise!!

customer_reviews.text: I really like the light weight of the Nuwave, and am amazed at how quickly it boils water. The 10 degree temp control is very accurate.

customer_reviews.text: Love it. Bought some pans to work with it and I am very pleased. Haven't used it much as yet, but will be soon. Just wished it came with a case to protect it.

customer_reviews.title: I love cooking on it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a secondary cook surface in a cramped kitchen. I love cooking on it. Heats up quickly. It's mobility lets me cook wherever is convenient. I actually like cooking on this better than my actual stove. I would buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly and the pan that comes with it is PERFECT! I've had it for 2 years now and I'm happy with it!!

customer_reviews.title: I totally love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had a couple more and room to use them. I totally love this thing. I quit burning all my food now. My husband loves that for sure. He uses it a lot as well. It gets hot very quickly and cools down fast so you really shouldn't burn anything.

customer_reviews.text: This is a great induction cook plate for the money! Easy to clean and store but most of all such a great item for camping or boating.

customer_reviews.text: Great!!! I bought this as a gift. I have one and it really makes a difference in cooking time. I recommend it.

customer_reviews.text: Wonderful - a must have in any kitchen! Works great, boils water fast - excellent for summer cooking so you don't have to heat up the entire kitchen!

customer_reviews.text: Love that it stays cool to the touch. At first had hard time telling it was on until started listening to the hum. Would help to have an "on"light.

customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 6 months. Yesterday while we we using it a huge spark shot up from the unit and it stopped working. Looks like we're out of warranty.

customer_reviews.title: NuWave Induction Burner
customer_reviews.text: I like this induction burner. I also have a Waring Pro one and prefer this one because I can control the temperature better and it has a timer function you can program. Not as noisy as some are saying (noise comes from fan) Larger than I thought it would be

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this cooktop
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cooktop. The pan that comes with it sucks but you can by affordable pans with induction bottoms that work great!! Heats extremely fast and cools quick. If I dont use the new wave oven then I use the cooktop. Great investment. I never use my burners anymore at all !!! I say buy cause its worth it. Just dont use their pans get your own!!

customer_reviews.text: Waited a long time to purchase this....was not disappointed. Have not stopped using it!

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very easy to control temperature although the setting ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, very easy to control temperature although the setting is slightly off. Starts to boil at 200 degrees and hard boil at 210. Still very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Danl70

customer_reviews.title: Great to take camping
customer_reviews.text: Great to take camping. Instead of using the gas stove top this works great. Can sit it outside and doesn't heat up the camper.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop1

customer_reviews.title: ... all the needs we purchased it for and a great
customer_reviews.text: This product fits all the needs we purchased it for and a great price
customer_reviews.author: TripleCrownJim

customer_reviews.title: I love induction cooking
customer_reviews.text: I love induction cooking. This the second one that i have in my house and i use it as my primary cooktop. Since i live in southern florida, i don't like to heat up the kitchen and this is great since it doesn't use heating coils and only heats the cookware. The only drawback is you need to make sure that the cookware has to be induction ready. I take a magnet with me when i shop at bargain stores and if the magnet sticks it will work on the induction cooktop. And all cast iron works well, so if you like cast iron and know how to care for it, it is a great backup
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Newsome

customer_reviews.title: You want this.  Yes, you do.  Click Add to Cart.
customer_reviews.text: I don't even use my stove cooktop any more. This is so much faster and safer with the kids. And when Im done, I just stick it in the pantry. Induction cooktop is AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Batchelor

product_meta.title: NuWave Precision Induction Cooktop 1300 Watts
product_meta.description: The NuWave Precision Induction Cooktop (PIC) offers precise temperature control, adjustable in 10-degree increments. With a minimum temperature setting of 100 Fahrenheit and an upper limit of 575 Fahrenheit (Sear), the PIC offers a wider temperature range than competitor models. This permits the appliance to act as more than just a cooktop. The NuWave PIC does the thinking for you. It offers state-of-the art programming technology with 100 hours of memory that allow you to prepare complex recipes with ease.. A delay function allows you to initiate cooking when it's most convenient for you, including an automatic shutoff function when cooking time is completed. The NuWave PIC was engineered with a circular design scheme, doing away with excess space that serves no cooking function. The PIC's round design also echoes the traditional feel of an intimate gathering place like the kitchen or dining room table. Mealtime is about community and the PIC was designed with that idea in mind. Despite its portability and compact size, the NuWave PIC offers a large cooking area, measuring 9 inches in diameter. In this case, bigger is better, with the PIC allowing for greater diversity in cooking vessels and portion sizes. The product also comes with unrivaled customer support and value-added resources such as lifetime membership to the online Precision Cooking Club. This invaluable tool features recipes, tips and tricks from the NuWave Culinary Team, designed to help you make the most of the PIC cooking experience. Pan is not included
feature_bullets: Magnetic cookware, or more accurately, induction-capable, is needed for induction to work. If a magnet sticks to the bottom of the pot, it will work with an induction cooktop. Please make sure you have the proper cookware for it to function properly.
The NuWave PIC has 6 different pre-programmed temperature settings, but has the flexibility to cook at 52 different temperatures between 100°F and 575°F, adjustable in 10-degree increments.
The NuWave PIC is equipped with programmable stage cooking functionality with up to 100 hours of program memory and performance.

Uses up to 70% less energy than conventional gas or electric ranges, lightweight and portable. Versatility to boil, simmer, deep-fry, stir-fry, saute, steam and sear, slow cook, barbecue, melt and grill.
The NuWave PIC boasts state-of-the-art safety features such as automatic shut-off when an induction-ready pan is removed from base, pan sold separately.
